derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'wedge'): of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch kloot 'ball, sphere' and German Kloss 'clod, dumpling', also to clot and clout

entry.tran: (尤指帆船上系绳用的)系索耳，羊角
entry.def: A cleat is a kind of hook with two ends which is used to hold ropes, especially on sailing boats.

means.word_mean: 1. a metal or leather projection (as from the sole of a shoe); prevents slipping
2. a fastener (usually with two projecting horns) around which a rope can be secured
3. a strip of wood or metal used to strengthen the surface to which it is attached
